torch: a bright light source at one end
totem pole: multiple figures or symbols carved into the pole, often depicting animals or people
tow truck: a winch or crane attached to the back of the truck
tractor: a cab with a steering wheel
semi-trailer truck: a long trailer attached to the back of the truck
tray: four sides with handles or edges
trench coat: usually made of a heavy, waterproof fabric
often has a belt and epaulettes
tripod: a platform or mount at the top for holding a camera or other device
triumphal arch: two tall, curved columns connected by a lintel at the top
trolleybus: two sets of double doors on the side of the bus
trombone: long, curved slide with a bell at the end
hot tub: jets of water or bubbles coming from the sides of the tub
turnstile: a mechanism for controlling access to a restricted area
typewriter keyboard: keys with raised letters and numbers
umbrella: a canopy of fabric or plastic
upright piano: a keyboard with black and white keys
a soundboard with strings and hammers
vacuum cleaner: a hose or tube attached to the main body
a motorized brush or roller on the bottom
vase: a narrow neck and a base for stability
vaulted or arched ceiling: ornate details such as moldings, carvings, or paintings
vending machine: a selection of buttons or a touchscreen display
vestment: ornamental decorations such as embroidery, lace, or beading
violin: a curved body with a scroll at the top
volleyball: bright colors, such as yellow, orange, or white
waffle iron: a grid pattern on the plates
wall clock: a pendulum or other mechanism for keeping time
wallet: multiple compartments for cards and cash
sink: a faucet or tap with a spout
washing machine: a control panel with knobs or buttons
water tower: a large tank at the top of the tower
whiskey jug: a wide neck and a handle
whistle: a hole at one end for blowing air through
hair wig: a cap or netting to hold the hair in place
window screen: a frame around the edges of the mesh or netting material
window shade: a roller mechanism at the top of the window for adjusting the shade
Windsor tie: a wide blade that tapers to a point at the bottom
wok: two looped handles on either side
wooden spoon: bowl-shaped head with a flat bottom
split-rail fence: gaps between the rails and posts
yurt: made of wooden poles and covered with felt or canvas
website: text, images, and other content on the screen
traffic or street sign: bright colors such as red, yellow, or white
symbols or words printed on the sign
traffic light: three colored lights (red, yellow, and green)
dust jacket: usually brightly colored with a design or artwork on the front
plate: usually made of ceramic, plastic, or metal
guacamole: chunks of tomato, onion, and/or cilantro
consomme: a thin layer of fat on the surface
hot pot: a heating element at the bottom of the pot
trifle: a combination of custard, jelly, fruit, sponge cake, and cream
ice cream: a variety of colors and flavors
popsicle: a wooden stick protruding from the center
hot dog: bun or roll on either side
cabbage: thick, white veins running through the leaves
artichoke: edible flower bud with a thick, fleshy base
bell pepper: four-sided shape with a pointed end
cardoon: long, spiny leaves with a silvery underside
mushroom: gills or pores on the underside of the cap
strawberry: small, green leaves at the top
lemon: dimpled skin with a pointed end
fig: smooth, thin skin with a deep purple or green color
jackfruit: yellowish-white flesh inside with edible seeds
carbonara: pasta dish with bacon, eggs, and cheese
meatloaf: a mixture of ground meat, eggs, breadcrumbs, and seasonings
pizza: toppings such as cheese, pepperoni, vegetables, etc.
pot pie: a filling of meat, vegetables, and gravy
burrito: a filling of meat, beans, cheese, and/or vegetables
red wine: glass bottle with a cork or screw cap
espresso: a small cup with a handle
tea cup: handle on one side of the cup
cliff: sharp drop off at the edge
geyser: a plume of steam or water shooting up from the ground
sandbar: sand or sediment deposits along the shoreline
beach: water, such as an ocean, lake, or river
vegetation, such as palm trees or other coastal plants
beach umbrellas, chairs, and other beach items
valley: a river or stream running through the valley
volcano: a crater at the top of the mountain
smoke or steam coming from the crater
baseball player: holding a baseball bat or glove
scuba diver: person wearing a diving mask and fins
person carrying a tank of air on their back
daisy: long, thin green stem with leaves
yellow lady's slipper: three petals with a slipper-like shape
two lateral petals that are fused together
corn: long, green husks with silky threads
acorn: a cap or cup-like structure at the top
horse chestnut seed: white, star-shaped mark on the seed
agaric: gills on the underside of the cap
stinkhorn mushroom: a slimy, smelly cap with a spore-bearing surface
earth star fungus: a spore sac in the center of the star
bolete: a stem with a ring around it
a yellow, brown, or red cap with a white or yellowish pore surface underneath
corn cob: husk or leaves surrounding the cob
toilet paper: a roll with a cardboard tube in the center
